summary: I always found it irritating, particularly when traveling on foot, that general goods merchants were so few and far between. So, limited modding experience in hand, I set out to change that.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3][b]VERSION 0.8 RELEASE: [/b][/size]
[list][*]There is now a version of this mod that does not use ApachiiHair. This should solve all problems with the game crashing because you're missing the proper hair files. 
[/*]
[*]Lysene now has a shack near Anise's Cabin. You can't get inside yet. I have plans for that. The inside is still a bit wonky, so I wouldn't suggest trying to explore.[/*]
[*][size=2]I've run into Lysene during my travels in Skyrim, so she's definitely out there! If you can't find her and you want her, open up the console and type: help "lysene" - you'll be able to find her NPC code. Then use the command player.placeatme (code). If I'm not mistaken, that should bring her directly to you.[/size][/*]
[/list]
I always found it irritating, particularly when traveling on foot, that general goods merchants were so few and far between. So, limited modding experience in hand, I set out to change that. This mod adds several general goods, or "pawnbroker" merchants, to Skyrim, in areas that didn't have them before. The goal of this mod is to create more convenience for the player while trying not to break lore too much. 

The following merchants have been added to Skyrim:
[list][*][size=2]Ellie, a Redguard woman who runs the shop "Ellie's Eccentricities," outside of Dawnstar, (and family: a husband, Arden, and a son, Brinn)[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Vorthir, a male Wood Elf who manages "Swamp's Edge Supplies" in Morthal next to the Jarl's Longhouse (and family: a sister, Vera)[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Katya, a Nord woman who lives and works out of a small shop next to the inn in Ivarstead (and dog: Patch)[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Walks-On-Ice, a female Argonian who stays in the Frostfruit Inn in Rorikstead[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]J'zira, a male Khajiit who sells caravan merchandise from the Four Shields Tavern in Dragon Bridge[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Francis Bonnefoy, a vampire Breton man (and fence) who hangs out outside of Enmon's house in Karthwasten[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Lysene the Wandering Merchant, an Imperial woman who (theoretically) wanders Skyrim looking for customers[/size][/*]
[/list][size=2]

[b]WORD OF CAUTION:[/b] As I said, I only partially know what I'm doing, so there may very well be errors. It all runs pretty smoothly in my game, but it's entirely possible that I've screwed something up, somewhere, and that I won't know until someone else plays with it. If you find any errors, bugs, or conflicts with other mods (there shouldn't be any unless you've done something like overhauled the area where they live or something), let me know. I can't guarantee I can fix them, so suggestions are always welcome, as well.

[/size]This mod is not finished, as I have a lot of other silly crap I want to add, and I'm thinking about putting in a few more merchants. Let me know what you think, and I hope you enjoy convenient pawnbrokers everywhere as much as I do!
author: Clockwork Grapefruit

files.name: General Goods Merchants Everywhere - No ApachiiHair
